title: Traci's Adobo Seasoning Recipe
description: This adobo seasoning made with simple pantry herbs and spices is easy to make and adds savory flavoring to chicken, fish, meat, and cottage cheese.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Traci's Adobo Seasoning 4.7 (182) 138 Reviews 13 Photos This adobo seasoning is often used in Mexican and Filipino dishes. I've recently started mixing my own seasonings. Submitted by Traci-in-Cali Updated on August 28, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 13 13 13 13 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 21 Yield: 7 tablespoons Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 21 servings 2 tablespoons salt 1 tablespoon paprika 2 teaspoons ground black pepper 1 ½ teaspoons onion powder 1 ½ teaspoons dried oregano 1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin 1 teaspoon garlic powder 1 teaspoon chili powder Directions Stir together salt, paprika, black pepper, onion powder, oregano, cumin, garlic powder, and chili powder in a bowl. Store in a sealed jar in a cool, dry place. I Made It Print 285 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 4 Calories 0g Fat 1g Carbs 0g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 21 Calories 4 % Daily Value * Total Fat 0g 0% Sodium 666mg 29% Total Carbohydrate 1g 0% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 0g Protein 0g 0% Vitamin C 1mg 1% Calcium 6mg 0% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 20mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Traci's Adobo Seasoning 01 of 13 Photo by  Linda T 02 of 13 Photo by  Shameca 04/16/2020 03 of 13 Photo by  julie 06/23/2019 Great seasoning. I just didn’t know how much to use on chicken I over did it A sprinkle would have worked 04 of 13 Photo by  Christine Davis 02/19/2019 05 of 13 Photo by  Chef Mo 01/16/2019 06 of 13 Photo by  Heidi 05/04/2015 I've made this recipe with half the salt, just because I'm kind of sensitive to salt. It tastes authentic and wonderful. I love it! Perfect for grilled chicken. I rubbed the chicken with the seasoning mix and a little avocado oil before grilling it. Thank you for a flavorful seasoning mix! 07 of 13 Photo by  BigShotsMom 07/05/2013 I have shied away from recipes calling for adobo seasoning because the commercially prepared have far more salt than we can tolerate a d often have MSG in the mix. I just reduced the salt in this blend by half and it is perfect for us. Thank you, Traci, this will become a staple in my kitchen. 08 of 13 Photo by  naples34102 02/27/2013 I'm always so happy to be the first to review a recipe, particularly when I can rate it highly. I'm not very familiar or experienced with Tex-Mex or Mexican cooking and the seasonings used, but I do know what I like. Going over the list of herbs and spices, hauling them out of the cabinet one by one, and then mixing them up all told me I was going to like this. The aroma was really wonderful, and it just looked, well, GOOD. My intention was to season some shrimp with this tomorrow but I was too curious to wait that long. I seasoned up a hamburger with this wonderful stuff and grilled it for lunch. It took the boring ol' hamburger and made it something truly special. Even tho' I'm not sure exactly what "Adobo" means or what it's used for, I still know that I can't wait to try this on other meats, chicken, rice, roasted potatoes or for marinades . As I started to make this I could have kicked myself because I had intended to make only half a recipe to start, to see if I liked it, but then realized I was dumping the full amounts into the mixing bowl. As it turned out my happy accident saved me the trouble of having to haul out all those spices again to make a second batch! Nice recipe, Traci. You got the combination and balance just right! 09 of 13 Photo by  naples34102 02/27/2013 I'm always so happy to be the first to review a recipe, particularly when I can rate it highly. I'm not very familiar or experienced with Tex-Mex or Mexican cooking and the seasonings used, but I do know what I like. Going over the list of herbs and spices, hauling them out of the cabinet one by one, and then mixing them up all told me I was going to like this. The aroma was really wonderful, and it just looked, well, GOOD. My intention was to season some shrimp with this tomorrow but I was too curious to wait that long. I seasoned up a hamburger with this wonderful stuff and grilled it for lunch. It took the boring ol' hamburger and made it something truly special. Even tho' I'm not sure exactly what "Adobo" means or what it's used for, I still know that I can't wait to try this on other meats, chicken, rice, roasted potatoes or for marinades . As I started to make this I could have kicked myself because I had intended to make only half a recipe to start, to see if I liked it, but then realized I was dumping the full amounts into the mixing bowl. As it turned out my happy accident saved me the trouble of having to haul out all those spices again to make a second batch! Nice recipe, Traci. You got the combination and balance just right! 10 of 13 Photo by  Linda T 06/09/2012 I used this in a chicken dish and also ended up sprinkling it in some mashed veggies.. really good. Gonna make a bigger batch and use often 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Creole Seasoning Blend 515 Ratings Lebanese Seven Spices 16 Ratings Blackened Seasoning Mix 184 Ratings Dry Spice Rub for Lamb or Beef 18 Ratings Taco Seasoning (without the chili powder) 87 Ratings Kosher Seasoning Salt 12 Ratings Mild Curry Powder 52 Ratings Herbs de Provence 71 Ratings Mediterranean Spice Rub 16 Ratings Cajun Seasoning Spice Mix 454 Ratings Ras el Hanout 48 Ratings Greek Spice Rub 10 Ratings Tandoori Masala Spice Mix 30 Ratings Homemade Taco Seasoning Mix 515 Ratings Great Steak Seasoning 20 Ratings Chili Seasoning Mix I 42 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Traci-in-Cali
instructions: Stir together salt, paprika, black pepper, onion powder, oregano, cumin, garlic powder, and chili powder in a bowl.;Store in a sealed jar in a cool, dry place.
